question: The schools debate team had 28 boys and _____. If they were split into groups of 4 how many groups could they make?
A vase can hold 5 flowers. _____ and 19 roses, how many vases would you need to hold the flowers?
John was organizing his baseball cards in a binder with 3 on each page. _____ and 16 old cards to put in the binder, how many pages would he use?
The cafeteria had 50 apples. For lunch they hand _____ and decided to use the rest to make pies. If each pie takes 5 apples, how many pies could they make?
April's discount flowers was having a sale where each flower was 6 dollars. _____ and 3 daisies, how much did she spend?
A new building needed 12 windows. _____. If it takes 4 hours to install each window, how long will it take him to install the rest?
Paige had 27 files on her computer. _____ and put the rest into folders with 6 files in each one. How many folders did Paige end up with?
Bianca had 34 songs on her mp3 player. _____ and then added 44 new songs, how many songs does she have on her mp3 player?
At the town carnival Oliver rode the ferris wheel 7 times and _____. If each ride cost 3 tickets, how many tickets did he use?
At the arcade Jerry won 4 tickets. _____ and later won 47 more tickets, how many would he have?
Wendy's old washing machine could only wash 8 pieces of clothing at a time. _____ and 33 sweaters how many loads would she have to do?
At the fair there were 10 people in line for the bumper cars. _____ and left and 2 more got in line, how many people would be in line?
A pet shelter had 8 puppies when another 19 were brought in. _____, how long would it take for all of them to be adopted?
Katie uploaded 30 pictures from her phone and _____. If she sorted the pics into 9 different albums with the same amount of pics in each album, how many pictures were in each of the albums?
Wendy was playing a video game and had 10 lives. _____. If she got 37 more lives in the next level, how many lives would she have?
Roger had 25 books. _____ and used the money he earned to buy 30 new books, how many books would Roger have?
Janet picked 4 tulips and _____. If she only used 11 of the flowers though, how many extra flowers did Janet pick?
Megan was selling her necklaces at a garage sale. She sold 7 bead necklaces and _____. If each necklace cost 9 dollars, how much money did she earn?
Nancy had 101 homework problems. _____. If each page has the same number of problems on it, how many problems are on each page?
Mike made 69 dollars mowing lawns over the summer. _____, how many 5 dollar games could he buy with the money he had left?
There were 17 girls and _____. If only 10 of them got called back, how many students didn't make the cut?
Edward and his friend were buying trick decks from the magic shop for 6 dollars each. _____ and his friend bought 6 decks?
Paul had saved up 4 dollars. _____, how many 5 dollar toys could he buy?
April's discount flowers was having a sale where each flower was 3 dollars. _____ and 2 daisies, how much did she spend?
At a company picnic 9 managers and _____. If they split into 8 teams how many people would be on each team?
Kaleb was collecting cans for recycling. On Saturday he filled 5 bags up and _____. If each bag had 4 cans in it, how many cans did he pick up total?
Ned was trying to expand his game collection. He bought 50 games from a friend and _____. If 74 of the games didn't work, how many good games did he end up with?
The school cafeteria ordered 6 red apples and _____. But, if only 5 students wanted fruit, how many extra did the cafeteria end up with?
Frank had saved up 3 dollars. _____, how many 8 dollar toys could he buy?
Luke was helping the cafeteria workers pick up lunch trays, but he could only carry 4 trays at a time. _____ and 16 trays from another, how many trips will he make?
A pet shelter had 17 puppies when another 55 were brought in. _____, how long would it take for all of them to be adopted?
Nancy was planting vegetables in her garden. She started with 52 seeds and _____ and in each of her small gardens put 4 seeds each. How many small gardens did Nancy have?
For homework Faye had 13 math problems and _____. If she can finish 3 problems in an hour how long will it take her to finish all the problems?
A magician was selling magic card decks for 9 dollars each. _____ and by the end of the day he had 7 left, how much money did he earn?
Dave had to wash 9 short sleeve shirts and _____. If he had only washed 20 of them by the time school started, how many did he not wash?
Faye had 34 coloring books. _____, but then bought 48 more, how many would she have total?
A store had 48 coloring books in stock. They ended up putting them on sale and _____. The put the ones they still had onto shelves with 5 on each shelf. How many shelves did they use?
Haley and her mom were picking carrots from their garden. Haley picked 39 and _____. If only 64 of the carrots were good, how many bad carrots did they have?
A toy store had 17 giant stuffed bears in stock when they got another shipment with 10 bears in it. _____. How many shelves did they use?
Paige had 43 math problems and _____. If she finished 44 of the problems at school, how many problems did she have to do for homework?
The cafeteria had 62 apples. For lunch they hand _____ and decided to use the rest to make pies. If each pie takes 9 apples, how many pies could they make?
There were 8 friends playing a video game online when 5 players quit. _____, how many lives did they have total?
Rachel bought two coloring books. _____ and the other had 32. After one week she had already colored 44 of the pictures. How many pictures does she still have to color?
At a company picnic 23 managers and _____. If they split into 6 teams how many people would be on each team?
While shopping for music online, Nancy bought 3 country albums and _____. Each album came with a lyric sheet and had 8 songs. How many songs did Nancy buy total?
A teacher had 38 worksheets to grade. _____, but then another 15 were turned in, how many worksheets would she have to grade?
Sam had 10 socks. _____ and bought 36 new ones, how many socks would he have?
Carol was playing a trivia game. In the first round she scored 17 points and _____. In the last round she lost 16 points. How many points did she have at the end of the game?
A store had 27 coloring books in stock. They ended up putting them on sale and _____. The put the ones they still had onto shelves with 7 on each shelf. How many shelves did they use?
In a video game, each enemy defeated gives you 3 points. _____ and you destroy all but 2 of them, how many points would you earn?
Nancy was organizing her book case making sure each of the shelves had exactly 6 books on it. _____ and 6 shelves of picture books, how many books did she have total?
Victor was helping the cafeteria workers pick up lunch trays, but he could only carry 7 trays at a time. _____ and 5 trays from another, how many trips will he make?
While shopping, Maria bought 40 green towels and _____. If she gave her mother 65 of them, how many towels did Maria end up with?
While playing at the arcade, Ned won 26 tickets playing 'whack a mole' and _____. If he was trying to buy candy that cost 9 tickets a piece, how many could he buy?
For Halloween Sarah received 66 pieces of candy from neighbors and _____. If she only ate 9 pieces a day, how long would the candy last her?
Olivia was making baggies of cookies with 9 cookies in each bag. _____ and 41 oatmeal cookies, how many baggies could she make?
A pet store has 4 bird cages. _____ and 2 parakeets in it, how many birds does the pet store have total?
While shopping for music online, Zoe bought 3 country albums and _____. Each album came with a lyric sheet and had 3 songs. How many songs did Zoe buy total?
Adam bought 2 boxes of chocolate candy and _____candy. If each box has 4 pieces inside it, how much candy did he have total?
A florist had 37 roses. _____ and then later picked 19 more, how many roses would she have?
Luke was selling his old games. He started out with 57 but sold 39 of them. _____. How many boxes did he have to use?
Katie had 85 files on her computer. _____ and put the rest into folders with 5 files in each one. How many folders did Katie end up with?
A store had 40 oranges in a bin. _____ and put 21 new ones in the bin how many would be in the bin?
Will had 57 dollars. _____, how many 6 dollar toys could he buy with the money he had left?
Paige had 11 songs on her mp3 player. _____ and then added 8 new songs, how many songs does she have on her mp3 player?
Jerry had 60 pieces of clothing to wash. _____, but decided to split the rest into 5 equal loads. How many pieces of clothing could go in each of the small loads?
A waiter had 6 tables he was waiting on, _____ and 5 men at each table. How many customers total did the waiter have?
Tom had 5 books. _____ and used the money he earned to buy 38 new books, how many books would Tom have?
At lunch a waiter had 7 customers and _____. If he got $9 each from the ones who did tip, how much money did he earn?
Chloe was playing a trivia game. In the first round she scored 40 points and _____. In the last round she lost 4 points. How many points did she have at the end of the game?
Emily was planting vegetables in her garden. She started with 41 seeds and _____ and in each of her small gardens put 4 seeds each. How many small gardens did Emily have?
Ned was trying to expand his game collection. He bought 11 games from a friend and _____. If 19 of the games didn't work, how many good games did he end up with?
For Halloween Emily received 5 pieces of candy from neighbors and _____. If she only ate 9 pieces a day, how long would the candy last her?
A waiter had 44 customers in his section. _____ and the rest of his tables had 8 people at each table, how many tables did he have?
A toy store had 6 giant stuffed bears in stock when they got another shipment with 18 bears in it. _____. How many shelves did they use?
A pet store has 6 bird cages. _____ and 7 parakeets in it, how many birds does the pet store have total?
Each chocolate bar in a box cost $3. _____ and Wendy sold all but 3 bars, how much money would she have made?
A book store had 41 books in the bargin bin. _____, but then put 2 more in the bin, how many books would be in the bin?
Kaleb had 10 video games but 8 of them weren't working. _____, how much money could he earn?
Wendy earned 5 points for each bag of cans she recycled. _____, but didn't recycle 2 of them, how many points would she have earned?
In a video game, each enemy defeated gives you 9 points. _____ and you destroy all but 3 of them, how many points would you earn?
The school cafeteria ordered 8 red apples and _____. But, if only 42 students wanted fruit, how many extra did the cafeteria end up with?
Olivia was playing a video game where she scores 8 points for each treasure she finds. _____ and 2 on the second, what would her score be?
Maria bought 2 new chairs and _____. If she spent 8 minutes on each piece furniture putting it together, how many minutes did it take her to finish?
Sarah had 4 pages of math homework and _____. If each page had 4 problems on it, how many problems did she have to complete total?
A painter needed to paint 9 rooms in a building. _____. If he already painted 5 rooms, how much longer will he take to paint the rest?
A waiter at 'The Greasy Spoon' restaurant had 26 customers to wait on. _____. If 27 of the customers didn't leave him a tip, how many customers did leave a tip?
While on vacation, Nancy took 49 pictures at the zoo and _____. If she later deleted 38 of the pictures, how many pictures from her vacation did she still have?
At the arcade Dave won 25 tickets. _____ and later won 15 more tickets, how many would he have?
The school cafeteria ordered 37 red apples and _____. But, if only 51 students wanted fruit, how many extra did the cafeteria end up with?
Paul had saved up 3 dollars. _____, how many 5 dollar toys could he buy?
Edward started his own lawn mowing business. In the spring he made 2 dollars mowing lawns and _____. If he had to spend 5 dollars buying supplies, how much money did he end up with?
Debby bought two coloring books. _____ and the other had 40. After one week she had already colored 33 of the pictures. How many pictures does she still have to color?
John made 6 dollars mowing lawns and _____. If he only spent 3 dollar a week, how long would the money last him?
For Halloween Debby and her sister combined the candy they received. Debby had 32 pieces of cand _____. If they ate 35 pieces the first night, how many pieces do they have left?
Tom bought 14 boxes of chocolate candy and _____. If each box has 3 pieces inside it, how many pieces did Tom still have?
Wendy had 82 files on her computer. _____ and put the rest into folders with 5 files in each one. How many folders did Wendy end up with?
A teacher had 29 worksheets to grade. _____, but then another 29 were turned in, how many worksheets would she have to grade?
A painter needed to paint 11 rooms in a building. _____. If he already painted 2 rooms, how much longer will he take to paint the rest?
Mike had 16 video games but 8 of them weren't working. _____, how much money could he earn?
